concept.title: Valve Arrangement in Internal Combustion Engines
concept.shortdesc: An engine's valve system controls the flow of gases into and out of the cylinder during the combustion process.

section.title: Valve Types and Functions
section.p: Each cylinder in the engine contains two critical valves:

dlentry.dd: Responsible for admitting fresh gas from the carburetor through the inlet pipe into the cylinder.
Enables the removal of exploded gases from the cylinder through the exhaust pipe.

section.title: Valve Operation Mechanism
section.p: The valves operate through a precise mechanical system:

ol.li: Cams on the cam shaft control valve movement
Push rods lift the valves from their seats
Valves alternate between open and closed positions

section.p: This synchronized mechanism ensures proper gas flow during the engine's combustion cycle.
